title.rendered: Smile Foundation receives CSR Health Impact Awards 2020 (Silver Award category) for Covid Relief Project, India Shares

content.rendered:
Smile Foundation was honored with the CSR Health Impact Awards 2020 under the Silver Award category of ‘COVID Relief Project (NGOs)’ for its extensive Dry Ration Distribution Program that aided thousands of migrant workers, women, children and the elderly under its initiative India Shares. Indi Shares is a multi pronged approach to the ongoing Covid-19 crisis which includes a comprehensive Food Supply Programme, A telephonic and digital Health Awareness Initiative, Baaton Baaton Mein Sehat and an initiative, Health Cannot Wait to take primary healthcare to the door steps of the underprivileged.

Smile Foundation, is an NGO in India directly benefitting over 15,00,000 children and their families every year, through more than 400 live welfare projects on education, healthcare, livelihood and women empowerment, in over 2000 remote villages and slums across 25 states of India.
